voiceClips.title: English Pronunciation Exercise
voiceClips.description: Practice your English pronunciation with this short sentence: "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
voiceClips.transcript: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
voiceClips.tips: Focus on the 'th' sound in 'the' and the 'x' sound in 'fox'.

voiceClips.title: French Accent Training
voiceClips.description: Improve your French accent with this phrase: "Je voudrais une tasse de café, s'il vous plaît."
voiceClips.transcript: Je voudrais une tasse de café, s'il vous plaît.
voiceClips.tips: Pay attention to the 'r' sound in 'voudrais' and the nasal sounds in 'une'.

voiceClips.title: Spanish Pronunciation Guide
voiceClips.description: Learn to pronounce this Spanish sentence correctly: "¿Dónde está la biblioteca?"
voiceClips.tips: Roll the 'r' in 'Dónde' and emphasize the accent on 'está'.

voiceClips.title: Japanese Greeting Practice
voiceClips.description: Practice this common Japanese greeting: "こんにちは、お元気ですか？" (Konnichiwa, o-genki desu ka?)
voiceClips.transcript: こんにちは、お元気ですか？
voiceClips.tips: Keep a steady rhythm and slightly rise in pitch at the end of the question.

voiceClips.title: German Pronunciation Challenge
voiceClips.description: Try this challenging German phrase: "Ich möchte Deutsch lernen, weil es eine interessante Sprache ist."
voiceClips.transcript: Ich möchte Deutsch lernen, weil es eine interessante Sprache ist.
voiceClips.tips: Focus on the 'ch' sound in 'ich' and 'möchte', and the 'r' sound in 'lernen'.

voiceClips.title: Italian Pronunciation Basics
voiceClips.description: Practice this Italian phrase: "Buongiorno, come stai oggi?"
voiceClips.tips: Roll the 'r' in 'Buongiorno' and emphasize the double consonant 'gg'.

voiceClips.title: Mandarin Chinese Tones
voiceClips.description: Practice the four tones in Mandarin with this phrase: "你好，我叫李明。" (Nǐ hǎo, wǒ jiào Lǐ Míng.)
voiceClips.tips: Pay close attention to the third tone in '你' (nǐ) and '好' (hǎo).

voiceClips.title: Russian Vowel Sounds
voiceClips.description: Practice Russian vowel sounds with this phrase: "Здравствуйте, как дела?" (Zdravstvuyte, kak dela?)
voiceClips.tips: Focus on the consonant cluster in 'Здравствуйте' and the unstressed 'o' in 'как'.

voiceClips.title: Korean Greeting Practice
voiceClips.description: Learn this basic Korean greeting: "안녕하세요, 만나서 반갑습니다." (Annyeonghaseyo, mannaseo bangapseumnida.)
voiceClips.tips: Keep a rhythmic pattern and pay attention to the pitch changes.

voiceClips.title: Arabic Pronunciation Basics
voiceClips.description: Practice these basic Arabic sounds: "مرحبا، كيف حالك؟" (Marhaban, kayfa haluk?)
voiceClips.tips: Focus on the guttural 'h' sound in 'مرحبا' (Marhaban) and the 'k' sound in 'حالك' (haluk).

analysisResults.feedback: Good attempt! Your pronunciation is clear, but you could improve the rhythm and intonation of the sentence.

pitch.feedback: Your pitch variation is good, but try to emphasize the rising intonation at the end of questions.

rhythm.feedback: The rhythm is slightly off. Try to maintain a more consistent pace throughout the sentence.

pronunciation.feedback: Your pronunciation of individual words is very good. Pay attention to the 'th' sound in 'the'.

analysisResults.feedback: Your French accent needs some work. Focus on the nasal sounds and the 'r' pronunciation.

pitch.feedback: Your intonation pattern is different from the native speaker. French has a rising pattern at the end of phrases.

rhythm.feedback: The rhythm is choppy. Try to connect words more smoothly in French.

pronunciation.feedback: The 'r' sound in 'voudrais' needs improvement. It should be more guttural.

analysisResults.feedback: Excellent Spanish pronunciation! Your accent is very natural.

pitch.feedback: Your question intonation is excellent, with the appropriate rise at the end.

rhythm.feedback: Good rhythm, but you could speed up slightly to match a native speaker.

pronunciation.feedback: Your rolled 'r' in 'Dónde' is very good. Keep practicing to make it even more consistent.
